        <h1 class="sectionedit1" id="plugins">Plugins</h1> 
        <div class="level1"> 
         <p> Plugins provide a system of extending DokuWiki's features without the need to hack the original code (and so again on each update). Below is a list of ready-to-use plugins created by DokuWiki users. </p> 
         <p> A plugin is installed by putting it into its own folder under <code>lib/plugins/</code>. From version Ponder Stibbons on this can be done automatically using the <a href="/plugin:extension" class="wikilink1" title="plugin:extension">extension</a> manager. (Up to version Binky this was done with the <a href="/plugin:plugin" class="wikilink1" title="plugin:plugin">plugin</a> manager.) Be sure to read about <a href="/security#plugin_security" class="wikilink1" title="security">Plugin Security</a>. See the detailed <a href="/plugin_installation_instructions" class="wikilink1" title="plugin_installation_instructions">plugin installation instructions</a>. </p> 
         <p> If you would like to help translating the plugins in another language, please see this page <a href="/localization#localizing_the_plugins" class="wikilink1" title="localization">Localization of&nbsp;plugins</a>. </p> 
         <h2 class="sectionedit2" id="search_plugins">Search Plugins</h2> 
         <div class="level2"> 
          <div class="pluginrepo_table"> 
           <div class="repoFilter"> 
            <p>Filter available plugins by type or by using the tag cloud. You could also search within the plugin namespace using the search box.</p> 
            <form action="/start" accept-charset="utf-8" class="plugin-search" id="dw__search2" method="get">
             <div class="no"> 
              <input type="hidden" name="do" value="search"> 
              <input type="hidden" id="dw__ns" name="ns" value="plugin"> 
              <input type="text" id="qsearch2__in" accesskey="f" name="id" class="edit"> 
              <input type="submit" value="Search" class="button" title="Search within namespace"> 
              <div id="qsearch2__out" class="ajax_qsearch JSpopup"></div> 
             </div>
            </form> 
            <h3>Filter by type</h3> 
            <ul class="types"> 
             <li>
              <div class="li">
               <a href="/plugins?plugintype=1#extension__table" class="wikilink1" title="List all Syntax plugins">Syntax</a> plugins extend DokuWiki's basic syntax.
              </div></li> 
             <li>
              <div class="li">
               <a href="/plugins?plugintype=4#extension__table" class="wikilink1" title="List all Action plugins">Action</a> plugins replace or extend DokuWiki's core functionality
              </div></li> 
             <li>
              <div class="li">
               <a href="/plugins?plugintype=2#extension__table" class="wikilink1" title="List all Admin plugins">Admin</a> plugins provide extra administration tools
              </div></li> 
             <li>
              <div class="li">
               <a href="/plugins?plugintype=16#extension__table" class="wikilink1" title="List all Helper plugins">Helper</a> plugins provide functionality shared by other plugins
              </div></li> 
             <li>
              <div class="li">
               <a href="/plugins?plugintype=8#extension__table" class="wikilink1" title="List all Render plugins">Render</a> plugins add new export modes or replaces the standard XHTML renderer
              </div></li> 
             <li>
              <div class="li">
               <a href="/plugins?plugintype=64#extension__table" class="wikilink1" title="List all Remote plugins">Remote</a> plugins add methods to the RemoteAPI accessible via web services
              </div></li> 
             <li>
              <div class="li">
               <a href="/plugins?plugintype=128#extension__table" class="wikilink1" title="List all Auth plugins">Auth</a> plugins add authentication modules
              </div></li> 
            </ul> 
           </div> 
           <div class="repoCloud"> 
            <h3>Filter by tag</h3> 
            <div class="cloud"> 
             <a href="/plugins?plugintag=%21broken#extension__table" class="wikilink1 cl2" title="List all plugins with this tag">!broken</a>

                <p class="description">Create table of contents for any wiki page in sidebar or in a wiki page.              <tr> 
              <td class="info"> 
               <div class="mainInfo"> 
                <strong><a href="/plugin:wrap" class="wikilink1" title="plugin:wrap">Wrap Plugin</a></strong> 
                <em><a href="https://github.com/selfthinker/dokuwiki_plugin_wrap/archive/stable.zip" class="urlextern" title="https://github.com/selfthinker/dokuwiki_plugin_wrap/archive/stable.zip">Download</a></em> 
                <p class="description">Universal plugin which combines the functionality of many other plugins. Wrap wiki text inside containers (divs or spans) and give them a class (choose from a variety of preset classes), a width and/or a language with its associated text direction.</p> 
               </div> 
               <dl>

                 Provides:
                </dt>

              <td class="info"> 
               <div class="mainInfo"> 
                <strong><a href="/plugin:userhomepage" class="wikilink1" title="plugin:userhomepage">User HomePage Plugin</a></strong> 
                <em><a href="https://github.com/geekitude/dokuwiki-plugin-userhomepage/archive/master.zip" class="urlextern" title="https://github.com/geekitude/dokuwiki-plugin-userhomepage/archive/master.zip">Download</a></em> 
                <p class="description">Creates users' private namespace and/or public page and redirects them to their own private namespace on login. The pages are base on customizable templates. The current version added the public page feature, a helper and many ACL settings to cover common</p> 
               </div> 
               <dl> 
                <dt>

                </dt>

                <strong><a href="/plugin:latexit" class="wikilink1" title="plugin:latexit">LaTeXit Plugin</a></strong> 
                <em><a href="https://github.com/Wrent/dokuwiki-plugin-latexit/archive/master.zip" class="urlextern" title="https://github.com/Wrent/dokuwiki-plugin-latexit/archive/master.zip">Download</a></em> 
                <p class="description">This plugin allows you to export single or multiple DokuWiki pages into one LaTeX file. It will export all media in a ZIP archive. It also supports exporting syntax from plugins imagereference, mathjax and zotero.</p>

                <em><a href="https://github.com/MrBertie/pagequery/zipball/master" class="urlextern" title="https://github.com/MrBertie/pagequery/zipball/master">Download</a></em> 
                <p class="description">An all-in-one multipurpose navigation plugin to create index pages; search/filter by full-text or page name; display in columns, grouped, sorted, even has content preview tooltips.</p> 
               </div>

                <em><a href="https://github.com/michitux/dokuwiki-plugin-searchtext/tarball/master" class="urlextern" title="https://github.com/michitux/dokuwiki-plugin-searchtext/tarball/master">Download</a></em> 
                <p class="description">Searches pages rendered as text instead of raw wiki. Displays search result snippets from rendered text. (Original author: Todd Augsburger)</p> 
               </div>
